comments.content:
@Jan Collijs:

That's odd, the option "force_config_drive" is available since the juno
release at least. It is declared in the file:

    /nova/virt/configdrive.py

Could you have a look at the file

    /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/virt/configdrive.py

please? This file should have a section [1] which looks like:

    cfg.StrOpt('force_config_drive',
           choices=('always', 'True', 'False'),
           help='Set to "always" to force injection to take place on a '
                'config drive. NOTE: The "always" will be deprecated in '
                'the Liberty release cycle.'),

References:
[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/kilo/nova/virt/configdrive.py#L40
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mzoeller

comments.content:
I double checked the /usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/virt/configdrive.py file and the section [1] was configured:

    # force_config_drive is a string option, to allow for future behaviors
    #  (e.g. use config_drive based on image properties)
    cfg.StrOpt('force_config_drive',
               choices=('always', 'True', 'False'),
               help='Set to "always" to force injection to take place on a '
                    'config drive. NOTE: The "always" will be deprecated in '
                    'the Liberty release cycle.'),

By looking the piece of code I realized I configured the true with a lower case t instead of a capital T. 

When configuring force_config_drive=True in nova.conf and restarting the nova compute service no errors appeared.

References:
[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/kilo/nova/virt/configdrive.py#L40
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~s-launchpat-f

comments.content:
@Jan Collijs:

Thanks for providing the informtation. This makes sense now. The Option does a case-sensitive check of the configured value with the set of string in "choices". Which means that "true" does not equal "True".  

@nova folks:
The error message should look differently though. I would expect an error message like

    Valid values are [%s], but found %s'

This should be looked into.

To avoid another bug like this one, "oslo.config" provides with commit 62ea3339a the option "ignore_case" since a few days.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mzoeller

comments.content:
@lyanchih:

> Besides if we want to modify error message.
> If we need to modify that in oslo.config repository?

IIUC the error message is already correct in oslo.config [1]:

        raise ValueError(
            'Valid values are [%s], but found %s' % (
                ', '.join([str(v) for v in self.choices]),
                repr(value)))

But this wasn't logged. Instead the log file showed a confusing:

    NoSuchOptError: no such option: force_config_drive

That's the issue I see here. I don't know the root cause.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/stable/liberty/oslo_config/types.py#L80

commit a71b7e18778d651a35cc514ff4d8c0ff393a68ad
Author: ChangBo Guo(gcb) <email address hidden>
Date:   Fri Jul 3 16:54:10 2015 +0800

    Don't convert ValueError into NoSuchOptError in ConfigOpts
    
    In method __getattr__ of ConfigOpts, we catch all exceptions and convert
    it to NoSuchOptError. This is wrong, we need allow raise ValueError to
    provide more details about the error.
    (cherry picked from commit 2576dd3eb139fe500567c8022429744903726a21)
    
    Closes-Bug: #1507516
